ref: 12477 śiśunāka m. ʻ *aquatic animal ʼ, ʻ king's name ʼ VP., śiśunāga -- m. ʻ king's name ʼ VP. v.l., ʻ young snake ʼ R., ʻ young elephant (= Pa. susunāga -- m.), demon ʼ MW. [Cf. words for ʻ dolphin, crocodile, lizard ʼ s.v. śiṁśumāˊra -- . For use of these words as nom. prop. cf. also śiśumārarṣi -- PañcavBr. and śiśupāla -- ~ G. susvāḷ ʻ crocodile ʼ. -- Associated by pop. etym. with śíśu -- , nāga -- 1]
